intervals.description: Replace engine oil and oil filter. Warm engine first for complete drain. The 550cc parallel-twin has a conventional spin-on oil filter — replace at every oil change.
intervals.torque_spec: Drain plug: 22 lb-ft (30 Nm), Oil filter: 13 lb-ft (18 Nm)

intervals.description: Drain and replace final drive gear oil. Check drain and fill plugs for metal debris. Higher torque from the 550cc twin means more stress on final drive gears.
intervals.torque_spec: Drain plug: 13 lb-ft (18 Nm), Fill plug: 13 lb-ft (18 Nm)

intervals.description: Remove CVT cover and inspect drive belt for cracks, fraying, glazing, and width. The 550cc twin puts significant load on the belt — inspect thoroughly for signs of heat damage.
Replace CVT drive belt regardless of condition. The AK 550i uses a heavy-duty belt designed for higher torque loads. Inspect variator and clutch faces for wear or scoring at the same time.
Remove variator and inspect roller weights for flat spots, uneven wear, or reduced diameter. Replace as a set if any roller is out of spec. AK 550i uses heavier rollers than single-cylinder scooters.
Remove and clean air filter element. Replace element every 12,000 km or sooner if damaged. Inspect more frequently in dusty conditions.
Replace both spark plugs (parallel-twin, two plugs). Check electrode condition, carbon fouling, and gap before install.
Check and adjust intake and exhaust valve clearances on both cylinders with engine cold. Parallel-twin has four valves total (two intake, two exhaust). Intake: 0.10-0.20mm, Exhaust: 0.20-0.30mm.
Drain and replace engine coolant. Bleed air from system after refill. Check hoses and clamps for leaks or deterioration. Larger engine produces more heat — do not skip this interval.
intervals.fluid_spec: Long-life coolant (ethylene glycol based, 50/50 premix) — 1.3L total capacity

intervals.description: Replace front and rear brake fluid. Bleed system completely until fluid runs clear. AK 550i has dual front disc brakes — bleed both calipers separately.
Check front and rear brake pad thickness. Replace when pad material reaches wear indicator groove or minimum thickness of 1.0mm. Heavier scooter with higher speeds — brake wear is accelerated.
Inspect and adjust throttle cable free play (2-6mm at grip). Lubricate cable with cable lubricant. Check for smooth operation through full range.
